alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 6:48PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, rises in small streams and normally dry washes, and water ponding on roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to earlier thunderstorms is causing small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas are likely causing minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen along with a sizable amount of pea sized hail. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected through 730 PM with the rain then tapering off. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Diversion Dam Rest Area, Bull Lake, Pilot Butte Reservoir, and locations along US Highway 26 around Diversion Dam.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Water and hail on roadways may easily cause hydroplaning. Be sure to slow down!
